doc.title: Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: Story 0.1: Project Initialization defines the foundation story for initializing the Next.js 15 project with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS. Includes acceptance criteria for project structure, TypeScript configuration, Tailwind CSS setup, ESLint configuration, build process, and development server.

doc.title: Architecture - Socratica
doc.snippet: Specifies the first implementation story using Next.js 15 starter template. Establishes base architecture decisions: Next.js 15 with App Router, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, App Router organization, Turbopack build tooling, ESLint configured, and REST API pattern via `/app/api/` routes.

doc.title: Architecture - Socratica
doc.snippet: Defines the expected directory structure for the socratica project including `app/` for Next.js App Router, `components/` for React components, `lib/` for utilities, `hooks/` for custom React hooks, `types/` for TypeScript types, and `public/` for static assets.

doc.title: Architecture - Socratica
doc.snippet: Establishes naming conventions: Components use PascalCase matching file name, files match component name exactly, functions use camelCase, constants use UPPER_SNAKE_CASE, types/interfaces use PascalCase.

doc.title: Architecture - Socratica
doc.snippet: Requires Node.js 18+, npm package manager. Development server runs on default Next.js port (typically 3000). Setup commands include npm install, environment variable configuration, and running npm run dev.

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: Classifies Socratica as a Level 3 web application project requiring comprehensive planning with greenfield approach. Technical stack includes web interface, LaTeX-based equation rendering, OCR/Vision LLM, and multi-turn dialogue with context maintenance.

tests.standards: Testing standards for this story focus on verifying project initialization setup rather than application functionality. Key verification points include: successful project creation via `npx create-next-app`, correct directory structure matching architecture document, TypeScript configuration with strict mode enabled, Tailwind CSS configuration and functionality, ESLint configuration and functionality, successful build process (`npm run build`), and successful development server startup (`npm run dev`). Manual verification is appropriate for this foundational story, with automated tests to be added in subsequent stories once the application codebase is established.

test.description: Verify project was created successfully by checking package.json exists and contains expected Next.js dependencies.
Verify project structure matches architecture: check all required directories exist (app/, components/, lib/, hooks/, types/, public/).
Verify TypeScript strict mode: check tsconfig.json has `strict: true` and import alias `@/*` is configured in paths.
Verify Tailwind CSS: check tailwind.config.js exists, verify PostCSS config, test utility classes work in a component.
Verify ESLint: run `npm run lint` and confirm no errors, check eslint.config.mjs exists.
Verify build: run `npm run build` and confirm build completes successfully without errors.
Verify dev server: run `npm run dev` and confirm server starts, check server is accessible at http://localhost:3000.
Verify directory structure: check all directories from AC 8 exist and match architecture document structure.
